Description.Text: The hotel walks among the pine trees twenty meters high, with no other noise than that of ripples in the water and song of birds, produces a sensation that it is necessary to experience and which is difficult to describe. It is fundamentally a highland village in the woods. It is an important tourist enclave, from which you will be able to do a complete gastronomic, historical and cultural tour through small routes around 30 and 100 kms. long, which can be made comfortably in the day, or relax in the wild countryside walking or in bicycle through nearby places of incomparable beauty. From the rocky headlands of the Nature Reserve "Canon del Rio Lobos" you can observe flocks of vultures, in Calata azor you will be able to visit the medieval castle where "Almanzor lost the drum" and in the Laguna Negra Black Lagoon you will be surprised at a bottomless lake, to which Becquer and Machado wrote poems. The forests that surround us constitute two opposites: those of the South, near to the park, junipers and sabinas on limy soil with great variety of fragrant and medicinal plants; those of the North, blackish pines that constitute a green mass that overcomes the limits of the village moving along the Urbi n and Demanda mountain ranges, thousands and thousands of acres of forest to discover and enjoy. 0310 FG Traditional building The Hotel La Reserva is situated in San Leonardo de Yague, in the province of Soria, which lies at the south most part of the Urbi n and Demanda mountain ranges and constitutes the biggest woodland in Europe. 50 kms from Soria and 2 hours by car from Madrid, Bilbao, Zaragoza and Logrono.

Guest Rooms - The rooms have a capacity of 33 m2, are equipped with bath, hairdryer, direct line telephone and Internet access. Also a minibar and a safe. San Leonardo counts with 60 rooms and 4 suites distributed through out three different buildings inside the forest
